page_content:
View Edit - Readings

Version:MissionOS_2.0

The View/Edit feature of an instrument allows users to view or modify certain instrument details existing in the application.

The View/Edit page of an instrument normally (dependent on individual portal specifics) has the following tabs:

  • Instrument Set Up (Definition)
  • Instrument Calibration
  • Calculated Calibrations
  • Review Setup
  • Readings
  • Review History
  • Edit History

 

To access the View/Edit – Edit History page, perform the following steps:

  1. Once you log into the application, go to Instrument Data section in the Homepage.
  2. Select the instrument required.
  3. Click View or edit instrument. (small bar chart symbol above graph thumbnail) You reach the View/Edit page where the Instrument Set Up is open by default.

Alternatively, click Data Manager from the Homepage of the portal (bar chart symbol top right). Select Instrumentation > Data > View/Edit.

 

Readings is one of the tabs present in the View/Edit page of an instrument. The tab consists of a number of functionalities which includes – adding or modifying records of data, filter fields, applying various actions to the data records and recalculate option.

You can filter the Readings data based specific criteria:

Load Data – Select the date range and click Load Data. The required readings of the time period get listed.

Load All Data – All available data of instrument is listed.

Reset – Click Reset button to go back to the initial selection.

Hide Bad Data – Select Hide Bad Data to hide the data involving Calculation Fail.

 

Adding records of data:

To add a new record of data to the instrument, perform the following steps:

  1. Click Add record. A new row of output fields populates in edit mode.
  2. Click to select the Taken On.
  3. You can see that in the example below (Figure 1) there are two data fields and one calculation field. As you enter the data fields, the calculation field auto-populates its value.
  4. If you enter data1 as 3.2 and data2 as 4.1, the Calculation field auto-populates as 8.9, which is the sum of first and second values along with the calibration value.

 

  1. Check with the Instrument Calibration interface for the latest revision in calibration value, which is 1.6 here. This validates the Calculation value generated as 8.9. This validates the Calculation value generated as 8.9. The Rev column displays which calibration revision is being applied to a given row of data.

 

 

 

  1. After typing the Remarks (if relevant), click Save. A pop-up can appear indicating a breached Alert by the calculation value generated, and prompting you for confirmation to continue saving.
  2. Click Yes to continue, or No to discontinue.
    Clicking Yes, a confirmation message appears that a new record of data is added. 
  3. Click Approve to give approval for the breach value.
    The new record gets listed in the table.

 

 

 

 

Note:

The auto-population of calculation field works based on the formula for calculation you add, in the Add Calculation Field while building the instrument model in the Object Definition page.

To check this, click the Model tab.

Select the Class Type, Class, Type and Subtype of the same instrument type as that selected in View or Edit page.

You can see that the Calculation formula for the same instrument is data1 + data2 + the calibration value.

 

 

 

Under Readings tab, you can apply various actions to selected data records like:

  • Revise
  • Quarantine
  • Unquarantine
  • Remove

 

 

Note:

The Revise Children option appears as an item in the All action types dropdown only when you select the Parent View/Edit page. For Normal instruments and Children View/Edit page, this option doesn’t appear as an item in the dropdown.

 

Action Type - Revise

  1. Select the row containing the record.
  2. Select Revise option from All action types.
  3. Then click Apply actions to selected data records.
  4. Click the Load Instrument button to update the changes.
  5. If you want to view the newly created revision, click open the Instrument Calibration Scroll down to see it listed at the bottom of the Revision table.
  6. In the Readings interface, view the newly revised data record listed in the table. 

 

 

 

Action Type – Apply Quarantine

This action type is automatically applied to those readings that show error or go beyond the filter range. Manually, this allows users to remove erroneous readings from graphs while keeping a record of them on the system.

  1. Select the data to be quarantined.
  2. Select the Quarantine option from the dropdown.
  3. Click the Apply Action button and confirm.
  4. Enter your Comments and click Ok.
    The data record gets quarantined indicated by Status ‘Q’ as seen in the Status column.

 

Note about Quarantine - Instruments in construction are meant to give a preset range of readings which are valid. For example, instruments are set up at construction site to measure settlements. Sometimes erroneous readings occur due to an instrument fault which are outside valid reading ranges. Filter range can be set for each data in Review setup page. If readings go outside this filter range, auto-quarantine happens. Each filter range is specific to each Review Field seen in Review Setup. If filter values are not set, then auto-quarantine cannot happen, therefore requiring manual quarantine. The quarantined readings are not taken for any analysis or reporting purpose.

 

Action Type - Unquarantine

Apply Unquarantine action type to release a data record from the Quarantine status.

  1. First, select the quarantined data.
  2. Then select the Unquarantine option from the dropdown.
  3. Click Apply Action.
  4. Finally confirm, by clicking the OK

 

Action Type - Remove

Apply the Remove action type to remove a specific row of instrument readings.

  1. Select the required data.
  2. Select the Remove option from the dropdown.
  3. Click the Apply Action button and confirm.
  4. Enter your Comments and click Ok.
    The selected row of readings gets removed and no longer appear in the Readings table.

 

Recalculating data:

Recalculating data is carried out for a variety of reasons, such as a new calibration revision being added or a given calculation being altered and subsequently data outputs must be revised.

  1. Select the row of instrument readings on that specific date.
  2. Click Recalculate Data.
  3. A Recalculate Records pop-up appears.
  4. In the pop-up, select From Date and To Date, the time period for which recalculation of data is to be performed.
  5. Then click Recalculate to trigger recalculation of data. Click OK to confirm.

 

Note:

  • Note that if you are logged in as an Admin user type and perform these actions, the data gets auto-approved in View or Edit page itself.
  • If you are logged in as Editor or Approver, the approval process takes place manually in the Audit page (dependent on portal settings).

 

 

Revising Children from Parent View/Edit:

You can revise children from Parent View/Edit page.

Pre-condition for Revise Children option to work is ‘Get from’ option must be configured in Model.

For this, follow the instructions as given:

  1. Select the Parent instrument from the Instrument Data interface of the Homepage – from the Instrument Selection
  2. Click View or Edit Instruments.
  3. You navigate to the View/Edit page of the Parent.
  4. Now click open the Readings
  5. Select the record to be revised.
  6. Then select Revise Children option from All action types dropdown menu.
  7. Click Apply actions to selected data records.
  8. The newly revised calibration file for children belonging to that Parent downloads to your system.
  9. An alert message pops up as “Master revised successfully. Please upload the downloaded calibration file for children.”

 

Note:

  • The Revise Children option appears as an item in the All Action Types dropdown in Readings tab only when you select the Parent View Edit page. For Normal instruments and Children View Edit page, this option doesn’t appear as an item in the dropdown.
  • Activating this functionality creates new revision for Parent as well as children.
  • Data from the selected taken_on and calculations from previous taken_on are used to fill the calibration file, based on the ‘Get from’ mapping.
  • You are required to upload the downloaded calibration file for the revision to complete correctly.

 

 

 

Click Show Status Log to go to the Instrumentation > Data > Audit > Status Log.

Here you can download the CSV file of the Status Log of the instrument.
